entry.title: Comparing Modelling Architectures in the context of EGFR Status Classification in Non Small Cell Lung Cancer
entry.content:
Authors: O Anderson, R Hung, S Fisher, A Weir, JP Voisey - medRxiv, 2026

Abstract: Radiogenomics enables the non-invasive characterisation of the genomic and molecular properties of tumours, with epidermal growth factor receptor (EGFR) mutations in non–small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) being one of the most investigated ...

Alert: Simon E. Fisher (author alert)

entry.title: Graphs are maximally expressive for higher-order interactions
entry.content:
Authors: TP Peixoto, L Peel, T Gross, M De Domenico - arXiv preprint arXiv:2602.16937, 2026

Abstract: We demonstrate that graph-based models are fully capable of representing higher- order interactions, and have a long history of being used for precisely this purpose. This stands in contrast to a common claim in the recent literature on" higher-order ...

Alert: Manlio De Domenico (author alert)

entry.title: Resting-state Compensatory Remapping in Patients with Brain Tumour Before and After Surgery
entry.content:
Authors: L Manso-Ortega, I Diez, L Amoruso, G Bermudez... - bioRxiv, 2026

Abstract: Brain tumours invade neural tissue, disrupting the functional organisation of neural networks. This disruption can trigger compensatory neuroplastic mechanisms that help preserve cognitive function despite pathological burden. Resting-state ...

Alert: Manuel Carreiras (author alert)

entry.title: Q&A with Tim Lenton: Navigating the new era of tipping points
entry.content:
Authors: T Lenton - One Earth, 2026

Abstract: Prof. Tim Lenton, Chair in Climate Change and Earth System Science at the University of Exeter, recently spoke with One Earth about the latest science, risks, and opportunities surrounding global tipping points. The views expressed are his ...
